document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Isometopus Fieber (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Miridae: Isometopinae) and a key to all known species of the genus in Europe and the Middle-East

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Isometopus Fieber (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Miridae: Isometopinae) and a key to all known species of the genus in Europe and the Middle-East

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male . Length 2.24; maximum width across hemelytra 1.36. Head width across vertex 0.50; dorsal length 0.12; facial width 0.68; facial length 0.46. Anterior inter-ocular space 0.20; posterior space 0.48. Dorsal width of eye 0.14; maximum width 0.24; height 0.30. Height of gena 0.06. Ocellus width 0.06; inter-occellar space 0.08. Maximum width of pronotum 1.10; median length 0.40. Scutellum length 0.62; width 0.60. Cuneus length 0.48; width 0.30. Rostrum 1.06. Antennae missing.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 6–7.
Isometopus praetermissum
sp. nov.
male habitus; dorsal view of head.

FIGURES 8–9.
Isometopus pretermissum
sp. nov.
female habitus; dorsal view of head.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pronotum subcampanulate, about 2.75x as broad as long; distinctly explanate laterally with margins arcuate; posterior margin bisinuate. Disk tumid convex, rather strongly raised at base and inclined forwards. Mesoscutum with lateral prominences strongly carinate; scutellum tumidly raised along central axis.

Dorsum generally shiny dark reddish-brown shading to dark-red to black on pronotal disk, mesoscutum and scutellum disk; tip of scutellum pale whitish, posterior humeral angles of pronotum somewhat pale reddish-brown. Generally transversely rugose punctuate, more strongly so on pronotum and scutellum; embolium impunctate, cuneus rather shallowly and sparsely punctuate. Apparently distinctly pubescent (specimen somewhat rubbed) with reclining to recumbent golden yellow hairs; these much shorter on cuneus, and intermixed with dark-red bristlelike hairs on embolium. Membrane dark reddish-brown, uniareolate.

Venter generally red to dark-red shading to black on some bands on abdominal sternites. Propleura densely punctuate, remainder of pleura and second abdominal sternite sparsely punctuate. Femora dark reddish-brown to dark-red, tips somewhat pale with reddish tinge; fore-tibiae, mesotibiae, tarsi, largely yellow-brown; metatibiae dark reddish-brown. Rostrum largely dark-red, basal band on segment IV pale; extending as far back as third abdominal sternite.
Female . Length 2.28(2.20–2.32); maximum width across hemelytra 1.67(1.60–1.72).

Head width across vertex 0.51(0.50–0.52); dorsal length 0.25(0.22–0.28); facial length 0.55(0.52–0.58); facial width 0.75(0.72–0.76). Anterior inter-ocular space 0.22; posterior space 0.62. Dorsal width of eye 0.13(0.12–0.14); maximum width 0.25(0.24–0.26); height 0.37(0.36–0.38). Height of gena 0.17(0.16–0.18). Ocellus width 0.04; interocellar space 0.12. Maximum width of pronotum 1.29(1.26–1.36); median length 0.45(0.44–0.46). Scutellum length 0.82(0.80–0.84); width 0.73(0.68–0.76). Cuneus length 0.51(0.48–0.52); width 0.40. Rostrum 1.12. Antennae I 0.12; others missing.

Pronotum about 2.86–2.96x as broad as long, inclined forwards; strongly explanate laterally with margins distinctly arcuate, forming with anterior margin a deep concavity around the head; posterior margin bisinuate.

Dorsum generally tumid convex with sides sloping laterad; cuneus and membrane distinctly declivous. Transversely rugose punctate (including embolium and cuneus), more strongly so on pronotal disk and scutellum. Apparently densely pubescent with reclining whitish sericeous hairs intermixed with finer semi-erect hairs (specimens rather extensively rubbed). General colouration dark reddish-brown, tip of scutellum pale whitish. Hemelytra with costal margin strongly arcuate, forming open angles anteriorly with pronotal margin and posteriorly with cuneus; membrane distinctly biareolate, rippled.

Venter dark reddish to black with pronotal flanges, broad lateral areas of abdominal sternites, and broad median band along ovipositor shaft, yellow-brown with reddish tinge. Pleura distinctly punctate, abdominal sternites finely so laterally. Legs with coxae and femora largely dark-red, tips of femora and trochanters pale reddishbrown. Tibiae dark reddish-brown at base, pale brownish apically; hind tarsi pale with tip dark reddish-brown. Rostrum with segment II pale brownish suffused with reddish and IV pale brownish at base, otherwise dark-red; extending as far back as sixth abdominal sternite.

Comments. This new species belongs in the nominotypic subgenus
Isometopus Fieber
and it is the tenth known species of the subgenus in Europe and the Middle East. It is closest to
I . nigritulus Akingbohungbe
, and can be readily separated from it and other species as indicated in the accompanying Keys to the species.

paragraph.materialsCitation: HOLOTYPE : male, S. Europe , 1974, H. M. Harris. ( USNM )

subSubSection.paragraph:
PARATYPES : Two females, same data as holotype. One female, Akzotizi Bay , Cyprus , 26 June, 1946, G. A. Mavromoustakis ( USNM )
.
